A limited number of full scholarships for training are now available!
Attention:  I will be making a formal announcement later, but a limited number of full scholarships are now available for FMFA inc. provided

training!   The scholarship money may be used to pay for our acclaimed 8 week Scrum Master/Scrum Product Owner course that combines classroom learning with an actual software development project.  It may also pay for our new Advanced Scrum Master  training designed to prepare students to pass a 2nd level Scrum Master exam and become one of the top 1% of all Scrum Masters in the world.  It may also be used to pay for our beginning and advanced Jira(r) classes, opening the door to a career in Jira(r) administration.

Scholarship applicants must have prior software development experience and must be able to prove they have been unemployed for at least 6 months. Applicants can expect to go through an interview process and will be accepted based on their likelihood to benefit from the training provided.
Please contact me if you are interested in applying!  I can be reached at ffowler@fmfa.com or by phone at (408) 357-9878.
@Abjayon Consulting is now Oracle Gold Partner! Thank you all for your wishes and support!

Senior Project Manager at Sony Playstation
April 13, 2016, Larry worked with Tim in the same group

Larry Apke? Here's what you need to know about Larry: Top-notch. Quality Agile coach. Passionate, self-aware, and talented. That's Mr. Apke in a nutshell. If that's all you need to hear, then feel free to stop there. Want more details? Here we go:I had the pleasure of working with Larry in two separate Agile coaching environments - one for Apple and one for Bank of the West. In fast-moving, dynamic and challenging environments, Larry is one of those guys you want with you in the trenches. It's not easy to undertake organization transformation, but Larry does it and he does it with style.My advice - grab him and don't look back. You'll never regret it. Let me know if I can provide more detail - happy to jump on the phone with anyone who needs to hear about the magic of Mr. Apke.

Marcus East
EVP & Chief Technology Officer - National Geographic
February 11, 2016, Marcus managed Larry directly

It's rare to meet someone who has a profound impact on one's thinking and approach, but Larry is one of those people.After a long search for a true Agile expert and coach who to support the agile transformation that I was driving, my team and I found Larry and were immediately impressed with his experience, and by his attitude and gravitas.Despite coming into a tough environment, he was quickly able to establish rapport and credibility with both engineers and senior leadership, and became a trusted advisor and partner who played a critical role in helping to shape my thinking and therefore our strategy.He combines a deep intellectual understanding of Agile Software Development and Agile principles with excellent hands-on experience as an engineer and excellent communication and relationship-building skills; I learned a great deal from Larry, and will be eternally grateful for the time we worked together.I cannot recommend Larry highly enough, and hope to have an opportunity to work with him again in the future.

Co-Founder, President, Startup School at Great North Labs
February 10, 2016, Larry worked with James in the same group

Larry Apke, truly a one of a kind professional and friend. I had the pleasure of working with Larry at Apple, but more importantly, learned a tremendous amount from Larry during our time there. Larry's professionalism, industry thought-leadership with Agile, has helped me in my career and bolstered my understanding of how to transform organizations into using Agile, effectively. Larry has inspired me and many others and taught me practical Agile lessons and strategies we can use in the real world. have had the opportunity to implement a lot of the tools and approaches he showed me at different organizations with tremendous success.Thank you Larry for your dedication, mentorship and passion for sharing your knowledge of Agile Approaches and Software Delivery Frameworks.

October 4, 2015, Larry worked with Saurabh in the same group

I have worked with Larry almost a year at Apple as a part of Agile Transformation initiative. He is BEST Agile coaches I have ever worked with. He has an excellent understanding of Agile practices and an outstanding coaching skills. He is very down to earth personality with rare blend of technical and process knowledge. He has written an amazing book on practical implementation of Agile Manifesto that reflects his solid hold on Agile practices and a MUST READ. Larry takes deep interest in exploring new information, Agile techniques, ideas , thoughts within and outside work areas. I always read his amazing blogs on Agile methodology . He is one of the most talented, capable tech savvy Agile coaches. I would love to work with him again in future. He would be an asset to any team and organization.

Larry is an accomplished Agile coach, Scrum Master, mentor, conflict solver, and knowledgeable of both the technical and business challenges facing software development teams today.After meeting our team members, he created a self organizing environment enabling individuals to come together and emerge as a high performance development team. He's a valuable asset to our Scrum team and American Express.

Sue Anderson
Sr. Director/Master Agile Coach
January 20, 2015, Sue managed Larry directly

I have had the pleasure of working with an Agile Coach; Larry Apke.  I am an Agile Enablement Manager that oversees the adoption and maturity of a portfolio within American Express. We enlisted Larry as an Agile coach to help support teams as we continue our adoption.  I was very pleased with Larry’s coaching.  He kept teams on track when they started to stray, taught us the principles of Agile, not only guided the teams but pushed them to try new ways outside of their comfort zones.   His coaching has definitely proven to be successful as our teams continue to grow.   I would highly recommend Larry as a coach/trainer for a team looking to understand, accept and respect what Agile Methodology has to offer and how it can bring benefits to a project/product/organization.

William Federe
Product Manager, Workday Community
August 25, 2016, William worked with Larry in the same group

I had the opportunity of working closely with William during my time as an Agile Coach at the Apple Online Store. Like all Agile transformations it was a challenging environment, with people like William expected to navigate many changes. The transition proved difficult for many, but if it were so for William, it was impossible to tell. He handled all the challenges with equanimity and an ever-present smile. He cared about the work and the people who did the work and was universally liked and respected. We had many excellent conversations in the morning, sharing ideas on how to create better products for the Apple Online Store. I hope that I get the chance to work with William again in the future and wholeheartedly recommend him.

summary: Leader in Software Development, Agile CoachProven Leader in Agile Development – Certified Scrum Master (CSM) - Certified Scrum Practitioner (CSP) - Certified SAFe Agilist (SA)Author of Understanding The Agile Manifesto: A Brief & Bold Guide to AgileA recognized leader in the Agile community and expert speaker, giving presentations to many different groups such as the Scrum Users Group, Java Users Group, Desert Code Camp and others. Founder of the Agile Coffee Group in San Antonio.Highly accomplished visionary executive with history of technology leadership and innovation. Results-oriented, decisive leader, with proven success devising and implementing solutions that deliver solid ROI for organizations in various industries, including financial, software, education, healthcare, and aviation. Adept at managing software development life-cycle projects using Agile techniques, building client relationships and establishing effective long-term IT and operations strategies. Excellent communicator and creative problem solver; proficient at leading software development teams.
name: Larry Apke
title: Agile Program Manager at Oracle
